```{r setup}
library(greta.distributions)
```

There are two main functions to help create and add new distributions to greta. These are:

- greta_dist_template(), and
- greta_dist_template_test()

These work by specifying the name of the distribution, and parameters. E.g.,

```{r}
gumbel_template <- greta_dist_template(
  dist_name = "gumbel",
  dist_arg_list = c("scale", "loc")
)

gumbel_template
```

We have the functions:

- `greta_dist_write()`, and
- `greta_dist_write_test()`

```{r}
greta_dist_write(
  dist_name = "lognormal", 
  dist_arg_list = c("meanlog", "sdlog")
  )
```
